result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Winnebago County Jail contacted for the purpose of arranging a video appearance for the defendant's 2/14 court appearance in this case.  Clerk was informed that defendant was released on a signature bond on February 2nd.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety. Not possess/consume any controlled substance without valid prescription or drug paraphernalia.

Prosecuting attorney Mandy A. Schepper appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Amy Lynn Rivers appeared by zoom video, in custody at WC Jail, Attorney Andrew D Leech appeared in court for Amy Lynn Rivers. Clerk: EZ. Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  State requests $500.00 cash bond.  Atty. Leech requests a signature bond.  Defendant eligible for State Public Defender.  Court orders $1,000.00 signature bond.  Defendant states will return to court.  Preliminary hearing time limits waived. Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.
